events.name: Programming Google Home, a FREE Build Actions for your Community event (Denver)
events.description:
Learn how to program voice interactions (and use Google Cloud)!

At this Actions on Google training seminar you will pick up the skills to make amazing voice interactions for millions of devices. Bring a laptop and walk through an on-site code lab after a presentation.

Ask an expert all your questions!

Speaker, Mark Scheel has presented on this topic at Google in California, in Las Vegas, in Denver (previously) and at an international conference in Toronto Canada. If he doesnâ€™t know, heâ€™ll help you find the answer to your question.

Enter to win a prize

We will have multiple raffle prizes including a Google Home Mini

Eat, and network

Take a pizza break with other local developers

Thank You

Thanks to Google Developer Group Denver and its sponsors including Google for making this FREE event possible.

Schedule

6:00PM-6:15PM NETWORKING
6:15PM-6:45PM PRESENTATION
6:45PM-8:00PM PIZZA HACK TIME (Code Lab)

Prerequisites

Some experience with Javascript will be helpful. To be successful in code lab you will need: A personal Gmail account (some corporate accounts have funny permissions), GitHub account, a web browser (eg Chrome), a text editor (MS Code, Sublime, Atom, etc), a terminal to run shell commands (donâ€™t be afraid, weâ€™ll help out)
events.how_to_find_us: Free neighborhood parking, arrive early for best spots

events.name: [Virtual] Google Cloud & Salesforce Webinar
events.description:
REGISTER HERE: https://www.salesforce.com/form/event/webinars/salesforce-webinar-1797414/

Today's customers want to be treated like individuals rather than numbers - and 66% will switch brands if they're not. But how do you personalize every interaction you have with them and exceed their expectations as you grow? It's time to rethink the way you work. Last year, Salesforce and Google announced a strategic partnership to help you do just that.

Join the two leading cloud platforms to learn how you can get to know your customers better and work smarter across your organization. See a demo of how the products work together, and learn from DroneDeploy, a leading drone software platform, how they use Salesforce and Google to bring customer insights into one place, cut data entry time in half, and sell faster than ever.

Register for the webinar today.

events.name: Denver Startup Week - Silicon Valley Interview
events.description:
You must RSVP here as well: https://www.denverstartupweek.org/schedule/4335-gdg-interview-silicon-valley-startup-perspective-for-denver

Flavius Popescu moved from London to the Bay Area to help Coffee Meets Bagel build the online dating Android app (1 million+ downloads in Google Play), and experience the tech startup scene there. Since, he has continued developing Android products and infrastructure at Pinterest and then Thumbtack - an online marketplace for local services. His office in the SF Market building has gourmet chefs and provides a unique perspective. We'll discuss careers, engineering, life and more as we explore parallels between Silicon Valley and Denver in this wide ranging interview followed by audience Q&A.

events.name: Holiday Ha Ha Ha (Party with DFN)
events.description:
Join Google Developer Group Denver in celebrating the holiday season with friends at the Denver Founders Network.

DFN exists to create a vibrant network of entrepreneurs sharing experiences, connections, and knowledge for startups to established companies.

This event is at a new venue near Coors Field, the Soda Pop Garage.

We will have pizza, and drinks, and comedy! Yes, comedy!

From 6-7PM a hosted show of various touring comedians who regularly perform at Comedy Works will sling jokes and get you in the holiday spirit. So arrive on time and enjoy the fun.

Hope to see you on Tuesday December 4!

events.name: I'm so done with E2E testing... until now.
events.description:
**** Talk Description ****
Testing applications from end to end (E2E) has always been a difficult proposition. From the days of Selenium to Webdriver, and now Protractor written specifically for Angular, this type of testing has taken far too much time and has been largely unproductive. The tests take too long to run and fail intermittently for no apparent reason at all. It's difficult to test features of an application without spending lots of time setting up "magic data" scenarios so we can verify that each aspect our application works as expected. This arduous process leads many developers to frustration and eventually resigning to using E2E testing for simple smoke tests.

No More!

Introducing Cypress.io, a new way of doing E2E tests that makes life incredibly simple and easy to manage. Cypress allows developers to focus on what's important and get the results we want without having to jump through a million hoops. We will be exploring what Cypress.io has to offer, how to set it up, and how it will change how you look at E2E tests.

**** Speaker Bio ****
Jesse Sanders is the founder and CEO of BrieBug and a Google Developer Expert (GDE) in Angular and Web Technologies. He regularly speaks around the world on Angular and related web technologies to inform and inspire developers on how to build the next generation of web applications. He regularly teaches workshops on Angular fundamentals, NgRx, and advanced Angular topics. He specializes in architecting systems using Angular for enterprise clients to help them achieve their goals. When not working, he enjoys spending time with his children, biking, skiing/snowboarding, hiking, and training for triathlons.

events.name: Progressive Web Apps ðŸš€ With Angular
events.description:
Let your Angular app take off into the world of progressive web apps (PWA). We'll learn the basics of building progressive web apps, using an app shell, working with service workers, and how Angular makes it easy to build performant progressive web applications that your users can install on their mobile devices. We'll also look at browser support and capabilities for app-like behaviors including notifications, background requests and sync, and more. If you have any interest in the future of apps and the web, then this meetup is for you! No prior knowledge of PWAs is required, but a little bit of knowledge of Angular would be helpful.

Brian Love is a software engineer and Google Developer Expert in Angular with a passion for learning, writing, speaking, teaching and mentoring. Brian has been building web applications for over 20 years and has long been a fanboy of JavaScript. When not in front of his MacBook Pro, Brian is in the Rocky Mountains skiing or hiking.

Schedule:

5:30-6:00 Food and Networking
6:00-6:15 Announcements & Comedy
6:15-7:00 Talk (same as done in Zurich two weeks ago)
7:00-7:30 Goodbye and so long (questions too)

events.name: NEXT '19 Extended Denver
events.description:
Join us for Next '19 Extended Denver! We will be gathering Cloud experts and folks who want to learn at a celebration of one of the largest Cloud events of the year.

Bring a laptop, we will have code labs and prizes. We will have free Qwiklabs credits, live speaker, streams of recorded content, and more information about Cloud Hero.

We will also have pizza, thanks to the Google Developers program.
